etymology.description: Depicts a hand with fingers; top stroke is a bent over middle finger, horizontal strokes represent fingers
etymology.interpretation: The character 手(手) (shǒu, "hand") is a direct pictorial representation of a human hand with all five fingers, which distinguishes it from similar characters representing claws or simplified fingers. This visually conveys its meaning as a hand clearly.

examples.chinese: 他用手写字(他用手寫字)。
妈妈牵着我的手走路(媽媽牽著我的手走路)。
examples.pinyin: Māmā qiān zhe wǒ de shǒu zǒu lù.
examples.english: Mom holds my hand while walking.

examples.chinese: 他的手很温暖(他的手很溫暖)，带给我力量(帶給我力量)。
examples.pinyin: Tā de shǒu hěn wēn nuǎn, dài gěi wǒ lìliàng.
examples.english: His hand is very warm, giving me strength.
